page.title: 10S'gate/The Green cont'd
page.content: {Houses:} The most important house in the area, Broomfield House, which was shown on the earliest maps of the parish was destroyed by fire last year. Much of the museum was rescued and also the Lanscroon Murals on the staircase but it is not yet certain whether the house can be restored. Cannon House, next to our school, is about 200 years old and is now used as a social club. One room has a strange fireplace with a window above it so the smoke had to run round the sides. The Hermitage, nearby, is the only thatched house left, and is near the corner of the park which is called the Village Gates because originally large gates stood there.
